Article.title: Greeks go to the polls for bailout referendum
Article.Description: With the austerity referendum polls now open, Greeks are contemplating how their vote will shape their future.

Article.title: Who is she? US police on the hunt to identify girl found dead in a bag
Article.Description: Police say who the girl is and how she died remain mysteries.

Article.title: Not having a good day: Fraser the lab rescued after becoming exhausted
Article.Description: A Labrador in distress and his tramper owner had to be rescued yesterday after suffering exhaustion.

Article.title: Girl killed after being struck by jumping sturgeon in boat
Article.Description: A five-year-old Florida girl riding in a boat has died after a sturgeon leaped from the Suwannee River and struck her.

Article.title: Greece teetering on the edge of collapse - but how did it get there?
Article.Description: Ahead of the vote, here are seven short explanations of how Greece got into today's mess.

Article.title: Child militants kill Syrian soldiers in sick new ISIS video
Article.Description: ISIS child killers have executed 25 Syrian government soldiers in an ancient Roman amphitheatre.

Article.title: Riders rescued after 120 metre ferris wheel stops
Article.Description: Riders were stranded on The Orlando Eye which towers 120 metres over central Florida.

Article.title: Syrian troops and Hezbollah besiege border mountain resort
Article.Description: Syrian elite forces backed by Hezbollah fighters besieged Zabadani under the cover of intense airstrikes

Article.title: State of emergency declared in Tunisia
Article.Description: Tunisia's president says the country is not safe from extremists.

Article.title: Rival rallies halt in Greece ahead of crucial referendum
Article.Description: Campaigns halt in Greece on Saturday on the eve of a closely watched bailout referendum - with voters in a dead heat over whether to defy creditors and push for better repayment terms or essentially seek new political leadership to find a compromise

Article.title: King Tupou VI crowned in coronation in Tonga
Article.Description: Thousands of visitors including foreign royals witnessed the coronation of King Tupou VI in Tonga this morning.

Article.title: Dalai Lama getting a 2.4m-tall cake for his 80th
Article.Description: It won't be a small, private affair when the Dalai Lama celebrates his 80th birthday this weekend in southern California.

Article.title: Bye bye, Baby: Coastguard called to save baby who drifted 1km out to sea
Article.Description: The 10-month-old's parents forgot she was had been left in a flotation device while at the beach.

Article.title: ISIS sets its sights on Israel firing rockets across Egyptian border
Article.Description: The Islamic State fired rockets from Sinai where Egyptian troops are battling the extremist group.

Article.title: Reporter robbed at gunpoint while on live TV
Article.Description: News crews were filming on a pier in San Francisco when a reporter was robbed at gunpoint.

Article.title: Boko Haram continue bloody Ramadan rampage in Nigeria
Article.Description: The terrorist group linked to ISIS has killed more than 170 people this week alone.

Article.title: Solar plane completes record-breaking flight across the Pacific Ocean
Article.Description: A plane powered by the sun's rays landed in Hawaii after a record-breaking five-day journey across the Pacific Ocean from Japan.

Article.title: 6.5 earthquake leaves buildings 'trembling' in China, six dead
Article.Description: Thousands of buildings are believed to have collapsed in the western region of Xinjiang.

Article.title: Britain is considering airstrikes in Syria
Article.Description: Britain is considering airstrikes in Syria in the wake of a heightened threat to its interests in the region.

Article.title: Financial woes hit Greek honeymooners as cards declined
Article.Description: The newlyweds long-planned trip to America ended in New York City, where their Greek-issued credit and debit cards were suddenly declined.

Article.title: Train derailment, fire prompts evacuation in US
Article.Description: A car on a freight train carrying a dangerous substance derailed and caught fire in Tennessee.

Article.title: Thousands pour into Tonga for Coronation of King Tupou VI
Article.Description: Foreign royals are among the visitors in Tonga ahead of tomorrow's Coronation of King Tupou VI.

Article.title: Leopard mauls guide's arm in attack in South African park
Article.Description: A leopard has mauled a guide in an attack on an open tourist safari vehicle in Kruger National Park.

Article.title: Animals given ice blocks as Europe swelters under record temperatures
Article.Description: Animals at Rome Zoo have been given a little help to stay cool, including frozen blocks of blood and meat.

Article.title: Ferry capsizes in Philippines; 35 dead, 20 missing
Article.Description: The ferry carrying 189 passengers and crew capsized minutes after it left a port in choppy waters.

Article.title: French mother jailed for nine years for killing eight newborns
Article.Description: The jury decided Dominique Cottrez's judgement was impaired when she killed eight of her newborns over more than a decade.

Article.title: Gulf states reach $27 billion settlement with BP over oil spill
Article.Description: The settlement, if accepted by a federal judge, would end a years-long battle between BP and the US government.
